titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C14

body.ab:
<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0091__main__1"/> We
passed a few sad
hours untill
eleven
<lb n="c56-0091__main__2"/> o'clock
when the trial was to
<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17250__Start"/>begin<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17250__End"/>commence<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17257__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17257__End"/>My
father
<lb n="c56-0091__main__3"/>
and
E<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17273__Start"/>father<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17273__End"/><del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17276__Start"/>El<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17276__End"/>
the rest of the family being obliged
<lb n="c56-0091__main__4"/>
to attend as
witnesses <del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17282__Start"/>Iac<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17282__End"/>
I accompanied them to
<lb n="c56-0091__main__5"/>
the court. During the whole of this wretched
<lb n="c56-0091__main__6"/>
mockery of
justice
I
sufferred
living
torture.<metamark>^</metamark><lb n="c56-0091__main__7"/>
It was to be
decided
whether the result of
<lb n="c56-0091__main__8"/>
my curiosity and
lawless<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17301__Start"/>desires<del loc="c56-0091__main__d1e17301__End"/>devices
would cause<lb n="c56-0092__main__1"/> the death of two of my
fellow beings.
One a
<lb n="c56-0092__main__2"/>
smiling
babe
full of innocence and
joy,
the
<lb n="c56-0092__main__3"/>
other far more dreadfully
murdered
with
<lb n="c56-0092__main__4"/>
every
agravation <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17321__Start"/>ignominy<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17321__End"/>
infamy that could
<lb n="c56-0092__main__5"/>
make
that
murder
<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17329__Start"/>more terrible<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17329__End"/>memorable
in horror. Justine
<lb n="c56-0092__main__6"/>
also was a girl of
merit
and possessed
<lb n="c56-0092__main__7"/>
qualities which promised to render her
<lb n="c56-0092__main__8"/><del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17343__Start"/>little world<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17343__End"/>life happy;
now all was to be oblite<lb n="c56-0092__main__9"/>rated in
an<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17357__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17357__End"/>
ignominious
grave ;
And I the
<lb n="c56-0092__main__10"/>
cause! A thousand times rather would
<lb n="c56-0092__main__11"/>
I have confessed myself guilty of the crime
<lb n="c56-0092__main__12"/>
ascribed to
Justine,
but I was absent when
<lb n="c56-0092__main__13"/>
it was
committed
and such a declaration
<lb n="c56-0092__main__14"/>
would
havebeen
considered as the ravings of
<lb n="c56-0092__main__15"/>
a
madman
and
could
not have excul<lb n="c56-0092__main__16"/>pated her who suffered through
me.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0092__main__17"/> The <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17393__Start"/>aff<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17393__End"/>
appearance of Justine was
<lb n="c56-0092__main__18"/>
calm. She was dressed in
<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17399__Start"/>morn<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17399__End"/> mourning
and
<lb n="c56-0092__main__19"/>
her countenance, always engaging, was
rendered <lb n="c56-0092__main__20"/>
by the solemnity of her
feelings exquisite <lb n="c56-0092__main__21"/> -ly
beautiful.
<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17408__Start"/>Yet she<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17408__End"/><del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17412__Start"/>Her mann<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17412__End"/>
Yet she
<lb n="c56-0092__main__22"/>
appeared confident in
innocence
and
<lb n="c56-0092__main__23"/>
did not
tremble
although gazed
at
and
<lb n="c56-0092__main__24"/>
execrated by
thousands. <del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17421__Start"/>fo<del loc="c56-0092__main__d1e17421__End"/>
For all the
kind <lb n="c56-0092__main__25"/> ness
which her beauty might
have
<lb n="c56-0092__main__26"/> gained from others
was obliterated
by
<lb n="c56-0092__main__27"/>
the
rememberance
of the enormity she was
<lb n="c56-0092__main__28"/>
supposed to have committed. She was
<lb n="c56-0092__main__29"/> tranquil
yet her tranquillity was
evident<lb n="c56-0093__main__1"/> constrained –
and as her confusion had
<lb n="c56-0093__main__2"/>
before been adduced as a proof of her
guilt <lb n="c56-0093__main__3"/>
she worked
<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17447__Start"/>herself<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17447__End"/>
up her mind to an appear<lb n="c56-0093__main__4"/>ance of courage. When she entered the
court <lb n="c56-0093__main__5"/>
she threw her eyes round
it
and quickly dis<lb n="c56-0093__main__6"/>covered where we were
seated –
a tear seemed
<lb n="c56-0093__main__7"/>
to dim her eye when she saw
us
but she
<lb n="c56-0093__main__8"/>
recovered
herself
and
<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17470__Start"/>g<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17470__End"/><del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17473__Start"/>with<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17473__End"/>
a
look<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17476__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17476__End"/>
of sorrow<lb n="c56-0093__main__9"/>ful affection seemed to attest her utter
<lb n="c56-0093__main__10"/> guiltlessness.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0093__main__11"/> The
trial
began <del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17492__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17492__End"/>listened attentive<lb n="c56-0093__main__12"/>ly wish
and
after the advocate against her
<lb n="c56-0093__main__13"/>
had stated the
charge
several witnesses
<lb n="c56-0093__main__14"/>
were called. Several strange facts combined
<lb n="c56-0093__main__15"/>
against
her
which
would
have staggered
<lb n="c56-0093__main__16"/>
any one who had not such
prof
of her
<lb n="c56-0093__main__17"/>
innocence as I had. She had been out the
<lb n="c56-0093__main__18"/>
whole of the night on which the mur<lb n="c56-0093__main__19"/>der had been
committed
and towards
<lb n="c56-0093__main__20"/>
morning had been perceived by a
<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17528__Start"/>farme<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17528__End"/><lb n="c56-0093__main__21"/><lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__1"/>market-woman
not far from the spot where
<lb n="c56-0093__main__22"/>
the body of the murdered child had been
<lb n="c56-0093__main__23"/>
afterwards found.
<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17545__Start"/>He asked her wh<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17545__End"/><del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17550__Start"/>She<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17550__End"/>The
woman<lb n="c56-0093__main__24"/> asked
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>her
what she did
there?–<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17575__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17575__End"/>but
she looked
<lb n="c56-0093__main__25"/>
very
<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17584__Start"/>stang<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17584__End"/> strangely
and only returned a
<lb n="c56-0093__main__26"/>
confused
<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0093.04">^</metamark><lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__1"/>&unin<lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__2"/>telligible<lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__3"/><metamark function="displacement">^</metamark> answer<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17610__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17610__End"/>. <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>She<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17623__Start"/>came<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17623__End"/>
returned to
<lb n="c56-0093__main__27"/>
the house about eight
o'clock
and
when
<lb n="c56-0093__main__28"/>
some
one
enquired
where she had
<lb n="c56-0093__main__29"/>
passed the
night
she
replied
that she
<lb n="c56-0093__main__30"/>
had been looking for the
child
and
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17647__Start"/>enquired<del loc="c56-0093__main__d1e17647__End"/>demanded<lb n="c56-0093__main__31"/>
earnestly
if any thing had been heard con<lb n="c56-0093__main__32"/>cerning him. When
the body was brought<lb n="c56-0094__main__1"/> into
the
house
she fell into violent
hys<lb n="c56-0094__main__2"/>terics
and kept her bed for several
<lb n="c56-0094__main__3"/>
days. The picture was then
produced <lb n="c56-0094__main__4"/>
which the servant had found in her
<lb n="c56-0094__main__5"/> pocket
and when
Elizabeth
in a falte<lb n="c56-0094__main__6"/>ring
voice
proved that it was the same
<lb n="c56-0094__main__7"/><del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17693__Start"/>she had<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17693__End"/>which<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17700__Start"/>the<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17700__End"/>
an hour before
<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17703__Start"/>the murder<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17703__End"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__8"/>
the child had been
missed,she
had placed round
<lb n="c56-0094__main__9"/>
his
neck
a murmur of
indignation <lb n="c56-0094__main__10"/>
and
horror
filled the
court.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__11"/> Justine
was
then
called on for
<lb n="c56-0094__main__12"/>
her defence.
God kno who reads all <lb n="c56-0094__main__13"/> hearts knows how
As the trial had
<lb n="c56-0094__main__14"/> proceeded
her countenance had altered.
<lb n="c56-0094__main__15"/> Surprise horror
and
misery
were
strong <lb n="c56-0094__main__16"/> ly
expressed. Sometimes she struggled
<lb n="c56-0094__main__17"/>
with her
tears <del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17737__Start"/>wh<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17737__End"/>
but
when she
<lb n="c56-0094__main__18"/>
was desired to
speak
she collected her
<lb n="c56-0094__main__19"/> powers
and
spoke
in an
audible
although
<lb n="c56-0094__main__20"/>
variable
voice.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__21"/> "God knows,"
she said,
"<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17751__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17751__End"/>how
entirely I
<lb n="c56-0094__main__22"/>
am
inocent.
but I do not pretend
to be <lb n="c56-0094__main__23"/> acquitted on account of
my protestations
<lb n="c56-0094__main__24"/>
I rest my innocence
<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17764__Start"/>a<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17764__End"/>
on a
simple
<lb n="c56-0094__main__25"/>
explanation of the
<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17772__Start"/>facts<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17772__End"/>facts
which have
<lb n="c56-0094__main__26"/>
been adduced against
me,
and I hope
<lb n="c56-0094__main__27"/>
the character I have always borne will
<lb n="c56-0094__main__28"/> encline
my judges to a favourable
<lb n="c56-0094__main__29"/> interpretation
where any
<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17789__Start"/>fact<del loc="c56-0094__main__d1e17789__End"/>circumstance
appears<lb n="c56-0095__main__1"/> doubtful or
suspicious.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__2"/> By the permission of Madlle Lavenza <lb n="c56-0095__main__3"/> I passed the evening with an aunt at <lb n="c56-0095__main__4"/> Chêne. One of my cousins returning from <lb n="c56-0095__main__5"/> Geneva said that he had been at the <lb n="c56-0095__main__6"/> house of M. Frankenstein and<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__7"/> She
then related
that
by the
<lb n="c56-0095__main__8"/>
permission of
Elizabeth
she had passed
<lb n="c56-0095__main__9"/>
the evening of the night on which the
<lb n="c56-0095__main__10"/>
murder
was perpetrated
at
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the
house of an aunt
<lb n="c56-0095__main__11"/> who resided in Chêne
a village
about
<lb n="c56-0095__main__12"/>
a league from Geneva. On her
return
<lb n="c56-0095__main__13"/>at about nine
o'clock
she met a
<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17855__Start"/>servant<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17855__End"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__14"/> man
who asked her if she had seen
<lb n="c56-0095__main__15"/>
any thing of the child who was lost. She
<lb n="c56-0095__main__16"/>
was
frightened at
this account, and passed
<lb n="c56-0095__main__17"/>
several hours in looking for
him
when
<lb n="c56-0095__main__18"/>
the gates of Geneva were
shut
and she
<lb n="c56-0095__main__19"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17875__Start"/>passed<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17875__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>was
forced to remain several
hours
of the
nightin
a
<lb n="c56-0095__main__20"/>
cottage,
but
unable to rest or sleep,
she
<lb n="c56-0095__main__21"/> rose early
that she might again
<lb n="c56-0095__main__22"/>
endeavour to find my brother. If she
<lb n="c56-0095__main__23"/>
had gone near the
<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17909__Start"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17909__End"/> spot<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17913__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17913__End"/>
where his
<lb n="c56-0095__main__24"/>
body
lay
it was without her
knowledge <lb n="c56-0095__main__25"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17921__Start"/>and she had been confused<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17921__End"/>That if
she had been bewildered when
ques <lb n="c56-0095__main__26"/> tioned
by the
market woman,
was
<lb n="c56-0095__main__27"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17933__Start"/>that<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17933__End"/>not surprising when
she
<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17941__Start"/>was so<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17941__End"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__28"/><del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17945__Start"/>c<del loc="c56-0095__main__d1e17945__End"/> was so wretched for
the
loss
of poor
<lb n="c56-0095__main__29"/> William.
Concerning the picture she
<lb n="c56-0095__main__30"/>
could give no
account. "I know,"
continued<lb n="c56-0096__main__1"/> the unhappy
victim<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17965__Start"/>e<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17965__End"/> "how
heavily and fatally this
<lb n="c56-0096__main__2"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17969__Start"/>o<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17969__End"/>
one circumstance
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17972__Start"/>we<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17972__End"/>
weighs against
me <lb n="c56-0096__main__3"/>
but I have no power of explaining
it
and
<lb n="c56-0096__main__4"/>
when I have expressed my utter
ignorance <lb n="c56-0096__main__5"/>
I am only left
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17982__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17982__End"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17985__Start"/>as any other is to conject<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17985__End"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17987__Start"/>ure<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17987__End"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__6"/>
to conjecture concerning the probabilities
<lb n="c56-0096__main__7"/>
by which it might have been placed in
<lb n="c56-0096__main__8"/>
my pocket. But
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17997__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e17997__End"/>
here also I am
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18002__Start"/>at a<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18002__End"/>checked<lb n="c56-0096__main__9"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18012__Start"/>stand<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18012__End"/>I
believe that I
have
have no enemy on
earth who <lb n="c56-0096__main__10"/> that I know
and none surely
who could
have
<lb n="c56-0096__main__11"/>
been so wicked as
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18028__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18028__End"/>
to destroy me
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18033__Start"/>so cruelly<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18033__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>wantonly.<lb n="c56-0096__main__12"/>
Did the murderer place it there? I know
<lb n="c56-0096__main__13"/>
of no opportunity afforded him for so
doing <lb n="c56-0096__main__14"/>
or
if I
had
why should he have stolen
<lb n="c56-0096__main__15"/>
the
jewel
to part with it
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>again
so
soon <del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18065__Start"/>again<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18065__End"/>?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__16"/> "I
commit my cause to the justice of
<lb n="c56-0096__main__17"/>
my
judges
yet I see no room for hope. I
<lb n="c56-0096__main__18"/>
beg permission to have a few witnesses exam<lb n="c56-0096__main__19"/>ined concerning my
character
and if
their<lb n="c56-0096__main__20"/>testimony
shall not
overweighmy
supposed
guilt<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18097__Start"/>is an apparent<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18097__End"/>
I
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18102__Start"/>shall<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18102__End"/>must<lb n="c56-0096__main__21"/>
be
condemned
although I
<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18112__Start"/>p<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18112__End"/>
would pledge
<lb n="c56-0096__main__22"/>
my salvation on my
innocence."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__23"/> Several
witnesses were
called
who had
<lb n="c56-0096__main__24"/>
known her for many
years
and they spoke
<lb n="c56-0096__main__25"/>
well of
her
but
fear
and hatred of the
<lb n="c56-0096__main__26"/>
crime of which they supposed her
guilty <lb n="c56-0096__main__27"/>
rendered them
timorous
and unwilling <lb n="c56-0096__main__28"/><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18133__Start"/>to
speak<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18133__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18140__Start"/>come
forward<del loc="c56-0096__main__d1e18140__End"/>. Elizabeth saw even this last
<lb n="c56-0096__main__29"/>
resource, her excellent
and irreproacha<lb n="c56-0096__main__30"/>ble
dispositions &
conduct, about to fail<lb n="c56-0097__main__1"/> the accused,
when
although
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18163__Start"/>uncalled<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18163__End"/><lb n="c56-0097__left_margin__1"/>
violently
<lb n="c56-0097__left_margin__2"/> agitated<lb n="c56-0097__main__2"/>
she desired permission to
speak. "I am" <lb n="c56-0097__main__3"/>
said
she "the
cousin of the unhappy
<lb n="c56-0097__main__4"/>
child who was
murdered
or rather his
<lb n="c56-0097__main__5"/> sister
for I was educated
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>by
and
lived
<lb n="c56-0097__main__6"/>
with his parents
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18198__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18198__End"/>
ever
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18201__Start"/>sin<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18201__End"/>
since and
<lb n="c56-0097__main__7"/>
long
before
his
birth;
it may therefore
<lb n="c56-0097__main__8"/>
be judged indecent in me to come
<lb n="c56-0097__main__9"/>
forward on this
occasion
but when
<lb n="c56-0097__main__10"/>
I see a
fellow creature
about to perish
<lb n="c56-0097__main__11"/>
through the cowardice of her pretended
<lb n="c56-0097__main__12"/> friends
I wish to be allowed to
speak
that
<lb n="c56-0097__main__13"/>
I may say what I know of her character.
<lb n="c56-0097__main__14"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18224__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18224__End"/>
I
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18229__Start"/>know a great deal<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18229__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>am
well acquainted with
it.<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18240__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18240__End"/>
I have
<lb n="c56-0097__main__15"/>
lived in the same house with
her
at
<lb n="c56-0097__main__16"/>
one time for
five
and
afterwards
for
<lb n="c56-0097__main__17"/>
nearly two years. During all that
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18252__Start"/>time<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18252__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>period<lb n="c56-0097__main__18"/>
she
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18265__Start"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18265__End"/>
appeared to me
a
most amiable
<lb n="c56-0097__main__19"/>
and benevolent
creature.
She
nurst <lb n="c56-0097__main__20"/>
my
aunt
in her last
illness
with the
<lb n="c56-0097__main__21"/>
greatest affection and
care
and
after <lb n="c56-0097__main__22"/> terwards
attended her
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>own
mother during a
<lb n="c56-0097__main__23"/> long &
tedious
illness <del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18289__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18289__End"/>
in a manner
<lb n="c56-0097__main__24"/>
that excited the admiration of all
<lb n="c56-0097__main__25"/>
who knew
her.
After which she again
<lb n="c56-0097__main__26"/>
lived in my
uncle's house
where she
<lb n="c56-0097__main__27"/>
was
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18303__Start"/>always a favourite<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18303__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>beloved
by all the family.
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18314__Start"/>Of the deceased<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18314__End"/><lb n="c56-0097__main__28"/>
she was
<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18322__Start"/>very<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18322__End"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18325__Start"/>fond<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18325__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>warmly
attached to the child who
has been murdered
and acted towards him
<lb n="c56-0097__main__29"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18337__Start"/>in<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18337__End"/>
like a most affectionate Mother.<lb n="c56-0097__main__30"/> for my own
part
I do not hesitate to
<lb n="c56-0097__main__31"/><del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18347__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0097__main__d1e18347__End"/>ay that not withstanding <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>all
the
evidence<lb n="c56-0098__main__1"/><lb n="c56-0098__left_margin__1"/>produced
against
her
I believe and rely on
<lb n="c56-0098__main__2"/>
her perfect innocence.
<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18381__Start"/>An<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18381__End"/>

temptation
<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18391__Start"/>and her dispo character<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18391__End"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18394__Start"/>whi<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18394__End"/>
for such an
action<lb n="c56-0098__main__4"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18399__Start"/>is amiable<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18399__End"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18402__Start"/>for<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18402__End"/>
as to the bauble on which
<lb n="c56-0098__main__5"/>
the chief proof
rests <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18409__Start"/>If<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18409__End"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18412__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18412__End"/>
if she had
<lb n="c56-0098__main__6"/>
earnestly
wished for it
I should have
<lb n="c56-0098__main__7"/>
willingly given it
her
so much

do

I esteem and value
her."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0098__main__9"/> Excellent
Elizabeth! A
murmur
<lb n="c56-0098__main__10"/>
of approbation
<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18440__Start"/>o<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18440__End"/>
was

<lb n="c56-0098__main__11"/>
was
<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18447__Start"/>on her account<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18447__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>excited
by her generous
interference&
not in favour
<lb n="c56-0098__main__12"/>
of poor
Justine
on whom the public
<lb n="c56-0098__main__13"/><del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18462__Start"/>ig<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18462__End"/> indignationwas
turned with renewed
<lb n="c56-0098__main__14"/>
violence, charging
herwith
the blackest
in- <lb n="c56-0098__main__15"/> gratitude. <del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18476__Start"/>For<del loc="c56-0098__main__d1e18476__End"/>
She herself wept as
<lb n="c56-0098__main__16"/>
Elizabeth
spoke
but she did not
<lb n="c56-0098__main__17"/>
answer. My own
agitation<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>&
anguish was extreme

during the whole
of the
trial.
The <lb n="c56-0098__main__19"/> picture was
I believed in her
inno<lb n="c56-0098__main__20"/>cence
I knew it. Could the
monster <lb n="c56-0098__main__21"/>
who had (I did not for a minute
<lb n="c56-0098__main__22"/>
doubt) murdered my brother,
alo
in
<lb n="c56-0098__main__23"/>

I could
<lb n="c56-0098__main__25"/>

and when I

un<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__4"/>happy<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__5"/>
victim<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18579__Start"/>her<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18579__End"/><lb n="c56-0099__main__2"/>
I rushed out of the court in agony. The
<lb n="c56-0099__main__3"/>
tortures of the accused did not equal
<lb n="c56-0099__main__4"/> mine
she was sustained by
innocence <lb n="c56-0099__main__5"/>
but the fangs of remorse tore my
bosom– <lb n="c56-0099__main__6"/> I
passed a night of unmingled wretched<lb n="c56-0099__main__7"/>ness. In the morning I went to the
<lb n="c56-0099__main__8"/>
court; my lips and throat were
<lb n="c56-0099__main__9"/>
parched. I dared not ask the fatal
<lb n="c56-0099__main__10"/> question –
but I was
known
and the
<lb n="c56-0099__main__11"/>
officer guessed
<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18615__Start"/>what I came to en-<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18615__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the

visit<lb n="c56-0099__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18625__Start"/>quire;<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18625__End"/> —
the ballots had been
thrown <lb n="c56-0099__main__13"/>
they were all
<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18633__Start"/>blak<del loc="c56-0099__main__d1e18633__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>black&
Justine was
<lb n="c56-0099__main__14"/> condemned.<lb n="c56-0100__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0100.01" unit="tei:head"/>Chapter 12<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__2"/> I
cannot
attempt
to describe what I
<lb n="c56-0100__main__3"/>
then
felt –
I had
<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18668__Start"/>had<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18668__End"/>experienced
sensations of
horror <lb n="c56-0100__main__4"/> before
and I have endeavoured to bestow
<lb n="c56-0100__main__5"/> on
them adequate
expressions
but
now <lb n="c56-0100__main__6"/>
words cannot convey
any
idea of the
<lb n="c56-0100__main__7"/> heart sickening
despair that I <del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18685__Start"/>then
felt<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18685__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>endured. <lb n="c56-0100__main__8"/><del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18698__Start"/>Nor<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18698__End"/>
The person to whom I
had
addressed
<lb n="c56-0100__main__9"/>
myself
also added
that Justine had al<lb n="c56-0100__main__10"/>ready confessed her guilt.
"That evidence"
he
<lb n="c56-0100__main__11"/> observed –"was
hardly required in so glaring
<lb n="c56-0100__main__12"/>
a
case
but
I
<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18714__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18714__End"/> am glad of it;
and indeed <lb n="c56-0100__main__13"/>
none of our judges like to condemn a
<lb n="c56-0100__main__14"/><del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18720__Start"/>ch<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18720__End"/>
criminal upon circumstantial
evi<lb n="c56-0100__main__15"/>dence<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18730__Start"/>let
it<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18730__End"/>
be<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it
ever so
decisive."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__16"/> When
I
returned
home
Elizabeth
<lb n="c56-0100__main__17"/>
eagerly
<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18752__Start"/>enquired<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18752__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>demanded
the
result. "My cousin" <lb n="c56-0100__main__18"/>
replied I,
"it
is decided as you may have
<lb n="c56-0100__main__19"/> suspected – <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>allJudges
had rather that ten
<lb n="c56-0100__main__20"/>
innocent should
suffer
than that
<lb n="c56-0100__main__21"/>
one guilty should
escape:
but she
<lb n="c56-0100__main__22"/>
has
confessed."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__23"/> This
was a
<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18791__Start"/>b<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18791__End"/>
dire blow to poor
Eliza<lb n="c56-0100__main__24"/>beth
who had relied with firmness
on <lb n="c56-0100__main__25"/> her
innocence.
"Alas!"
said
she "How <lb n="c56-0100__main__26"/>
shall I ever again believe in human
<lb n="c56-0100__main__27"/> benovolence –
Justine, whom I loved and
<lb n="c56-0100__main__28"/>
esteemed as my
sister.
How could she
<lb n="c56-0100__main__29"/>
put on
<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18811__Start"/>thos<del loc="c56-0100__main__d1e18811__End"/>
those smiles of innocence
<lb n="c56-0100__main__30"/>
only to
betray–
her mild eyes seemed inca<lb n="c56-0101__main__1"/>pable of any severity or
ill
humour
and
<lb n="c56-0101__main__2"/>
yet she has
<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18830__Start"/>com<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18830__End"/>
committed a
murder."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__3"/> Soon
after we heard that the
<lb n="c56-0101__main__4"/>
poor victim had expressed a
wish
to
<lb n="c56-0101__main__5"/>
see my cousin. My father wished her not
<lb n="c56-0101__main__6"/>
to
go
but
said
that he left it to her
<lb n="c56-0101__main__7"/>
own
judgement
and feelings to decide.
<lb n="c56-0101__main__8"/> "Yes,"
said
Elizabeth "I
will
go
although
<lb n="c56-0101__main__9"/>
she is
guilty –
and
you Victor
shall
acco<lb n="c56-0101__main__10"/>pany me –I
cannot go
alone". <del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18857__Start"/>This<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18857__End"/>
The
<lb n="c56-0101__main__11"/>
idea of this visit was torture to
me <lb n="c56-0101__main__12"/>
yet I could not
refuse.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__13"/> We
entered the gloomy
prison cham<lb n="c56-0101__main__14"/>ber
and beheld Justine sitting on some
<lb n="c56-0101__main__15"/>
straw at the
further
end; her hands
<lb n="c56-0101__main__16"/>
were
mannacled
and her head rested
<lb n="c56-0101__main__17"/>
on her
<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18882__Start"/>knews<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18882__End"/> knees,–
she rose on seeing
<lb n="c56-0101__main__18"/>
us
and when
<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18887__Start"/>th<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18887__End"/>
we were left alone
<lb n="c56-0101__main__19"/>
with
her
she threw herself at the
<lb n="c56-0101__main__20"/>
feet of
Elizabeth
weeping bitterly.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__21"/> My cousin wept
also – Oh Justine <lb n="c56-0101__main__22"/>
said she,
why
did you rob me of my
<lb n="c56-0101__main__23"/>
last
consolation –
I
<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18906__Start"/>believed<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18906__End"/>reliedon
your
<lb n="c56-0101__main__24"/> innocence
and although I was
very
<lb n="c56-0101__main__25"/><del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18922__Start"/>wh<del loc="c56-0101__main__d1e18922__End"/> wretched
I was not so miserable
<lb n="c56-0101__main__26"/>
as I am
now."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__27"/> "And
do you also believe that I am
<lb n="c56-0101__main__28"/>
so
very
very
wicked–?<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>Cried Justine
Do you also join
<lb n="c56-0101__main__29"/>
with my enemies to crush
me?
Her
<lb n="c56-0101__main__30"/>
voice was suffocated with
sobs.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__31"/> "Rise
my poor
girl,"
said
Elizabeth <lb n="c56-0101__main__32"/> "why
do you
kneel
if you are
innocent<lb n="c56-0102__main__1"/>
I am not one of your
enemies,
I believed
in <lb n="c56-0102__main__2"/> your innocence
notwithstanding every
<lb n="c56-0102__main__3"/> evidence untill
I heard that you had
<lb n="c56-0102__main__4"/>
yourself declared your guilt. That
report <lb n="c56-0102__main__5"/>
you
say
is
false,
and be
assured my <lb n="c56-0102__main__6"/>
dear
Justine
nothing can
for a minute <lb n="c56-0102__main__7"/>
shake my confidence in you
but
<lb n="c56-0102__main__8"/>
your own
confession–"<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0102__main__9"/> "I
did
confess" said Justine "but <lb n="c56-0102__main__10"/>
I confessed a lie. I
confessed
that I
<lb n="c56-0102__main__11"/>
might obtain
absolution
but now
<lb n="c56-0102__main__12"/>
that falsehood lies heavier at my
<lb n="c56-0102__main__13"/>
heart than all my other sins. The God
<lb n="c56-0102__main__14"/>
of heaven forgive me! Ever since I
<lb n="c56-0102__main__15"/>
was
condemned
my confessor has besieged
<lb n="c56-0102__main__16"/> me,–
he threatened and
menaced untill <lb n="c56-0102__main__17"/>
I almost began to think that I was
<lb n="c56-0102__main__18"/>
the
wicked wretch
he said I was. He
<lb n="c56-0102__main__19"/>
threatened
excomunication
and Hell
<lb n="c56-0102__main__20"/>
fire in my last
moments
if I con<lb n="c56-0102__main__21"/>tinued obdurate. Dear Lady, I had none
<lb n="c56-0102__main__22"/>
to support
me –
all looked on me
<lb n="c56-0102__main__23"/>
as a wretch
doom
to ignominy and
<lb n="c56-0102__main__24"/> perdition;
what could I do? In an evil
<lb n="c56-0102__main__25"/>
hour I
<del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19031__Start"/>confessed<del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19031__End"/>
subscribed to a
lie <lb n="c56-0102__main__26"/>
and now only
I
am
truly
miserable." She <lb n="c56-0102__main__27"/>
paused, weeping, and then
continued. <lb n="c56-0102__main__28"/> "I
thought with horror, my sweet lady,
<lb n="c56-0102__main__29"/>
that you should
<del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19043__Start"/>sho<del loc="c56-0102__main__d1e19043__End"/>
believe
that<lb n="c56-0103__main__1"/>
your
Justine
whom your
bessed <lb n="c56-0103__main__2"/>
aunt had so highly
honoured
and
<lb n="c56-0103__main__3"/>
whom you loved, was a
wretch
capa<lb n="c56-0103__main__4"/>ble
of<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a
crime which
<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19076__Start"/>not<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19076__End"/>none
but the
<lb n="c56-0103__main__5"/>
devil himself
<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19087__Start"/>was capable of<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19087__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could
have perpetrated. Dear
<lb n="c56-0103__main__6"/> William,
dearest blessed
child,
I soon
<lb n="c56-0103__main__7"/>
shall see you again in
heaven &<lb n="c56-0103__main__8"/> glory
and that consoles
me
going as
<lb n="c56-0103__main__9"/>
I am to suffer ignominy and
de"ath.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__10"/> "Oh Justine" cried the weeping <lb n="c56-0103__main__11"/> Elizabeth, "forgive
me for having for
<lb n="c56-0103__main__12"/>
one moment distrusted
you – <del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19119__Start"/>But<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19119__End"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__13"/>
why
didyou
confess? But do not
mourn <lb n="c56-0103__main__14"/>
my
dear
girl,
I will
every where
<lb n="c56-0103__main__15"/>
proclaim
your
innocence
and
will <lb n="c56-0103__main__16"/>
force belief. Yet
you
must
die – <lb n="c56-0103__main__17"/> you
my
companion,
my
playfellow, <lb n="c56-0103__main__18"/>
my
more than
sister— die –I never <lb n="c56-0103__main__19"/>
never
can
survive so horrible
<lb n="c56-0103__main__20"/>
a
misfortune".<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__21"/> "Dear
Sweet
lady,"
do not
weep"– <lb n="c56-0103__main__22"/><del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19148__Start"/>sai<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19148__End"/> replied Justine"–
you ought
to
<lb n="c56-0103__main__23"/>
raise me
<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19153__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19153__End"/>
with thoughts of a better
<lb n="c56-0103__main__24"/><del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19160__Start"/>world<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19160__End"/>life,
and elevate me from the
<lb n="c56-0103__main__25"/>
petty cares of this world of injustice
<lb n="c56-0103__main__26"/>
and
strife –Do
not you, excellent
<lb n="c56-0103__main__27"/> Elizabeth
drive
me
to
despair."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__28"/> Elizabeth <del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19178__Start"/>Em<del loc="c56-0103__main__d1e19178__End"/> embraced the suffer <lb n="c56-0103__main__29"/> er "I
will try
to
comfort
you," said she,<lb n="c56-0104__main__1"/>
but
this
I
fear
is an evil too deep
and
poignant
<lb n="c56-0104__main__2"/>
to admit of
consolation <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19197__Start"/>or<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19197__End"/>
for there is no
hope <lb n="c56-0104__main__3"/>
Yet heaven bless thee, my dearest Justine,
<lb n="c56-0104__main__4"/>
with
resignation
and
<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19207__Start"/>a
hope<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19207__End"/>a
confidence elevated
<lb n="c56-0104__main__5"/>
beyond this world.
Oh
how I hate
all
its
shews
<lb n="c56-0104__main__6"/>
and
mockeries.–
When one creature is
<lb n="c56-0104__main__7"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19221__Start"/>deprived of life<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19221__End"/>murdered<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19231__Start"/>they<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19231__End"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19234__Start"/>bel<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19234__End"/>another
is immediately
mur<lb n="c56-0104__main__8"/>der<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19249__Start"/>another<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19249__End"/>deprive
of
life in a slow torturing
<lb n="c56-0104__main__9"/> manner &<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>then
the
executioners
their hands yet reeking with the blood
of
innocence
believe that they have done <lb n="c56-0104__main__10"/>a great
<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19282__Start"/>things<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19282__End"/>deed.
They call this
retribution;
hate<lb n="c56-0104__main__11"/>ful name! When that
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>word
is
pronounced <lb n="c56-0104__main__12"/>
I
know
that
greater and more horrid
<lb n="c56-0104__main__13"/>
punishments are going
to
be inflicted
<lb n="c56-0104__main__14"/>
than
the
gloomiest tyrant has
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>everin<lb n="c56-0104__main__15"/> ventented
to
satiatehis
utmost revenge. Yet this
<lb n="c56-0104__main__16"/>
is not consolation
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>for
you, my Justine,
<lb n="c56-0104__main__17"/>
unless indeed that you may glory
<lb n="c56-0104__main__18"/>
in escaping
so miserable a den. Alas!
<lb n="c56-0104__main__19"/>
I would I were
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in
peace with my aunt & my
<lb n="c56-0104__main__20"/> sweet William – <del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19371__Start"/>in peace<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19371__End"/>
escaped
<lb n="c56-0104__main__21"/>
from
light
which
<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19379__Start"/>I abhor<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19379__End"/>is
hateful to
me
and the
<lb n="c56-0104__main__22"/>
visages of men which
are hateful to <lb n="c56-0104__main__23"/> me."
I
abhor.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0104__main__24"/> Justine
smiled languidly.
"This,
dear
Lady <lb n="c56-0104__main__25"/> said she
is
despair
and not resignation.
<lb n="c56-0104__main__26"/>
I must not learn
the
lesson that you
<lb n="c56-0104__main__27"/>
would teach
me –
talk
of somthing else
<lb n="c56-0104__main__28"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19407__Start"/>of
fields<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19407__End"/><del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19410__Start"/>s<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19410__End"/> of
something that
will
<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19413__Start"/>brig jo<del loc="c56-0104__main__d1e19413__End"/><lb n="c56-0104__main__29"/>
bring
joy
and not
encrease
of
misery."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__1"/> During
this conversation I had retired
<lb n="c56-0105__main__2"/>
to a corner of the
prison-room
where
<lb n="c56-0105__main__3"/>
I could conceal the horrid anguish
<lb n="c56-0105__main__4"/>
that possessed
me–
Despair! Who dared
<lb n="c56-0105__main__5"/>
talk of that? The poor
victim
who
<lb n="c56-0105__main__6"/>
on the morrow was to pass the
<lb n="c56-0105__main__7"/>
dreary
boundary
of
life &
death
felt
<lb n="c56-0105__main__8"/>
not as I
did —
Such deep & bitter
agony <lb n="c56-0105__main__9"/>
I gnashed my
teeth
and ground them
<lb n="c56-0105__main__10"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19449__Start"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19449__End"/> together
uttering a groan that came
<lb n="c56-0105__main__11"/>
from my inmost soul. Justine
started <lb n="c56-0105__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19455__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19455__End"/>
when she saw who it
was <lb n="c56-0105__main__13"/>
she approached
me. "Dear Sir," said <lb n="c56-0105__main__14"/> she, "you
are very kind to visit me;
<lb n="c56-0105__main__15"/> you
I
hope
do not believe that I am
<lb n="c56-0105__main__16"/> guilty."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__17"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19476__Start"/>"<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19476__End"/>I
could not
answer – "No Justine" <lb n="c56-0105__main__18"/>
said Elizabeth;
"he
is
<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19482__Start"/>even<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19482__End"/>
more
<lb n="c56-0105__main__19"/>
convinced of your innocence than
<lb n="c56-0105__main__20"/>
I
was
for even when he heard
<lb n="c56-0105__main__21"/>
that you had
confessed
he did not
<lb n="c56-0105__main__22"/><del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19495__Start"/>believe<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19495__End"/>credit it."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__23"/> "I
truly thank
him"– said Justine <lb n="c56-0105__main__24"/> "In
these last
minutes
I feel the
<lb n="c56-0105__main__25"/>
sincerest gratitude
for
those who
<lb n="c56-0105__main__26"/> still
think of me with kindness. How
<lb n="c56-0105__main__27"/>
sweet is the affection of others to
<lb n="c56-0105__main__28"/>
such a wretch as I
am –
It removes
<lb n="c56-0105__main__29"/>
more than half my
misfortune <lb n="c56-0105__main__30"/>
and I feel as if I could die in
<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19526__Start"/>pea<del loc="c56-0105__main__d1e19526__End"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__1"/> peace. <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19535__Start"/>thn<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19535__End"/>
now that my innocence
isacknow<lb n="c56-0106__main__2"/>ledged
by you,
sweet
lady, and your
cousin."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__3"/> Thus
the poor sufferer
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19550__Start"/>cr<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19550__End"/>
tried
<lb n="c56-0106__main__4"/>
to comfort others and herself. She indeed
<lb n="c56-0106__main__5"/>
gained the resignation she
wished for <lb n="c56-0106__main__6"/>
but
I
the true
murderer <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19560__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19560__End"/>
felt
<lb n="c56-0106__main__7"/>
the
never dying
worm alive
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19567__Start"/>and I was<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19567__End"/>which<lb n="c56-0106__main__8"/>
allowed
no hope or consolation. Eliza<lb n="c56-0106__main__9"/>beth also
wept
and was
unhappy
but
<lb n="c56-0106__main__10"/> hers<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>also
was
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19595__Start"/>also<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19595__End"/>
the misery of
innocence <lb n="c56-0106__main__11"/><del loc="c56-0106__left_margin__d1e19604__Start"/>that<del loc="c56-0106__left_margin__d1e19604__End"/>which
like a cloud
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19614__Start"/>that<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19614__End"/>that
passes over the
<lb n="c56-0106__main__12"/>
fair
moon <del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19625__Start"/>which<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19625__End"/>&
for a while
<lb n="c56-0106__main__13"/>des
but cannot
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19638__Start"/>disturb<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19638__End"/>destroy
its
brightness <lb n="c56-0106__main__14"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19647__Start"/>but<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19647__End"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19650__Start"/>misery<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19650__End"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19653__Start"/>&<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19653__End"/><del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19656__Start"/>desp<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19656__End"/>
anguish and
<lb n="c56-0106__main__15"/>
despair had
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19662__Start"/>penetr<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19662__End"/>
penetrated into
<lb n="c56-0106__main__16"/>
the core of my
heart –
I bore a hell
<lb n="c56-0106__main__17"/>
within
me that
nothing could
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19671__Start"/>diminish<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19671__End"/>extinguish.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__18"/>
We
staid
several hours with
Justine <lb n="c56-0106__main__19"/>
and
<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19684__Start"/>with<del loc="c56-0106__main__d1e19684__End"/>
it was with great difficulty
<lb n="c56-0106__main__20"/>
that Elizabeth
tore
herself
away <lb n="c56-0106__main__21"/> "I wish"
cried
she that
I were to die
<lb n="c56-0106__main__22"/>
with
you –
I cannot live in this world
<lb n="c56-0106__main__23"/>
of
misery." Justine
assumed an air
<lb n="c56-0106__main__24"/>
of
Cheerfullness
while she with diffi<lb n="c56-0106__main__25"/>culty repressed
the
bitter
tears – "Farewell <lb n="c56-0106__main__26"/>
sweet lady, dearest
Elizabeth
may
heaven
<lb n="c56-0106__main__27"/>
in its
bounty
bless and preserve
you<lb n="c56-0107__main__1"/>
May this be the last misfortune that
<lb n="c56-0107__main__2"/>
you will ever
suffer.
– live
& be
happy <lb n="c56-0107__main__3"/> to
make
<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19732__Start"/>of<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19732__End"/>
others
so.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0107__main__4"/> As
We
returned
Elizabeth said,
You <lb n="c56-0107__main__5"/> do not know,
my
dear Victor,
<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19742__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19742__End"/>
how
<lb n="c56-0107__main__6"/>
much I am
relieved
now that
I
trust
<lb n="c56-0107__main__7"/>
in
the
innocence
of
this unfortunate
<lb n="c56-0107__main__8"/>
girl.
I
never could again have
<lb n="c56-0107__main__9"/>
known
peace
if I had been deceived
<lb n="c56-0107__main__10"/>
in
my
reliance
on
her. For
the
mo<lb n="c56-0107__main__11"/>ment that
I
did believe
it
I felt
<lb n="c56-0107__main__12"/><del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19764__Start"/>such<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19764__End"/>
anguish
that
I could not have
<lb n="c56-0107__main__13"/>
long sustained. Now
my
heart is light<lb n="c56-0107__main__14"/>ened. The innocent
suffers –
but
she
<lb n="c56-0107__main__15"/>
whom I thought amiable and good
<lb n="c56-0107__main__16"/> is
not
wicked
and
I am
consoled."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0107__main__17"/>Amiable<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19788__Start"/>Sweet<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19788__End"/>
Cousin! Such were
your
<lb n="c56-0107__main__18"/> thoughts
mild and gentle
as
your
<lb n="c56-0107__main__19"/>
dear
eyes
<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19797__Start"/>&<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19797__End"/><del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19800__Start"/>gentle tone<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19800__End"/>
and
voice.<lb n="c56-0107__main__20"/> but
I.—— I
was a
wretch <del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19808__Start"/>none<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19808__End"/>&<lb n="c56-0107__main__21"/>
none ever conceived
<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19814__Start"/>of<del loc="c56-0107__main__d1e19814__End"/> the
misery
<lb n="c56-0107__main__22"/>
that
I
then
suffered.
